get.description: Use this to retrieve sentences extracted from corpora which show how a word is used in the language. This is available for English and Spanish. For English, the sentences are linked to the correct [sense](documentation/glossary?term=sense) of the word in the dictionary. In Spanish, they are linked at the [headword](documentation/glossary?term=headword) level.

get.description: Use this to retrieve definitions, [pronunciations](documentation/glossary?term=pronunciation), example sentences, [grammatical information](documentation/glossary?term=grammaticalfeatures) and [word origins](documentation/glossary?term=etymology). It only works for dictionary [headwords](documentation/glossary?term=headword), so you may need to use the [Lemmatron](documentation/glossary?term=lemma) first if your input is likely to be an [inflected](documentation/glossary?term=inflection) form (e.g., 'swimming'). This would return the linked [headword](documentation/glossary?term=headword) (e.g., 'swim') which you can then use in the Entries endpoint. Unless specified using a region filter, the default lookup will be the Oxford Dictionary of English (GB).

Filters can also be combined using a semicolon.

get.description:
This endpoint returns frequencies of ngrams of size 1-4. That is the number of times a word (ngram size = 1) or words (ngram size > 1) appear in the corpus. Ngrams are case sensitive ("I AM" and "I am" will have different frequency) and frequencies are calculated per word (true case) so "the book" and "the books" are two different ngrams. The results can be filtered based on query parameters.

Parameters can be provided in PATH, GET or POST (form or json). The parameters in PATH are overridden by parameters in GET, POST and json (in that order). In PATH, individual options are separated by semicolon and values are separated by commas (where multiple values can be used).

Example for bigrams (ngram of size 2): * PATH: /tokens=a word,another word * GET: /?tokens=a word&tokens=another word * POST (json): ```javascript { "tokens": ["a word", "another word"] } ``` Either "tokens" or "contains" has to be provided.

Some queries with "contains" or "sort" can exceed the 30s timeout, in which case the API will return an error message with status code 503. You mitigate this by providing additional restrictions such as "minFrequency" and "maxFrequency".

You can use the parameters "offset" and "limit" to paginate through large result sets. For convenience, the HTTP header "Link" is set on the response to provide links to "first", "self", "next", "prev" and "last" pages of results (depending on the context). For example, if the result set contains 50 results and the parameter "limit" is set to 25, the Links header will contain an URL for the first 25 results and the next 25 results.

Some libraries such as python's `requests` can parse the header automatically and offer a convenient way of iterating through the results. For example: ```python def get_all_results(url): while url: r = requests.get(url) r.raise_for_status() for item in r.json()['results']: yield item url = r.links.get('next', {}).get('url') ```

parameters.description: IANA language code
parameters.name: source_lang

parameters.description: For corpora other than 'nmc' (New Monitor Corpus) please contact api@oxforddictionaries.com
parameters.name: corpus

parameters.description: the size of ngrams requested (1-4)
parameters.name: ngram-size

parameters.description: List of tokens to filter. The tokens are separated by spaces, the list items are separated by comma (e.g., for bigrams (n=2) tokens=this is,this was, this will)
parameters.name: tokens

parameters.description: Find ngrams containing the given token(s). Use comma or space as token separators; the order of tokens is irrelevant.
parameters.name: contains

parameters.description: Flag specifying whether to lookup ngrams that include punctuation or not (possible values are "true" and "false"; default is "false")
parameters.name: punctuation

parameters.description: Option specifying whether tokens should be returned as a single string (option "google") or as a list of strings (option "oup")
parameters.name: format

parameters.description: Restrict the query to entries with frequency of at least `minFrequency`
parameters.name: minFrequency

parameters.description: Restrict the query to entries with frequency of at most `maxFrequency`
parameters.name: maxFrequency

parameters.description: Restrict the query to entries that appear in at least `minDocumentFrequency` documents
parameters.name: minDocumentFrequency

parameters.description: Restrict the query to entries that appera in at most `maxDocumentFrequency` documents
parameters.name: maxDocumentFrequency

parameters.description: collate the results by wordform, trueCase, lemma, lexicalCategory. Multiple values can be separated by commas (e.g., collate=trueCase,lemma,lexicalCategory).
parameters.name: collate

parameters.description: sort the resulting list by wordform, trueCase, lemma, lexicalCategory, frequency, normalizedFrequency. Descending order is achieved by prepending the value with the minus sign ('-'). Multiple values can be separated by commas (e.g., sort=lexicalCategory,-frequency)
parameters.name: sort

parameters.description: pagination - results offset
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: pagination - results limit
parameters.name: limit

404.description: language is not in...

500.description: Internal Error. An error occurred while processing the data.

get.summary: Retrieve the frequency of ngrams (1-4) derived from a corpus

get.description:
This endpoint provides the frequency of a given word. When multiple database records match the query parameters, the returned frequency is the sum of the individual frequencies. For example, if the query parameters are lemma=test, the returned frequency will include the verb "test", the noun "test" and the adjective "test" in all forms (Test, tested, testing, etc.)

If you are interested in the frequency of the word "test" but want to exclude other forms (e.g., tested) use the option trueCase=test. Normally, the word "test" will be spelt with a capital letter at the beginning of a sentence. The option trueCase will ignore this and it will count "Test" and "test" as the same token. If you are interested in frequencies of "Test" and "test", use the option wordform=test or wordform=Test. Note that trueCase is not just a lower case of the word as some words are genuinely spelt with a capital letter such as the word "press" in Oxford University Press.

Parameters can be provided in PATH, GET or POST (form or json). The parameters in PATH are overriden by parameters in GET, POST and json (in that order). In PATH, individual options are separated by semicolon and values are separated by commas (where multiple values can be used). Examples: * PATH: /lemma=test;lexicalCategory=noun * GET: /?lemma=test&lexicalCategory=noun * POST (json): ```javascript { "lemma": "test", "lexicalCategory": "noun" } ```
One of the options wordform/trueCase/lemma/lexicalCategory has to be provided.

parameters.description: IANA language code
parameters.name: source_lang

parameters.description: For corpora other than 'nmc' (New Monitor Corpus) please contact api@oxforddictionaries.com
parameters.name: corpus

parameters.description: The written form of the word to look up (preserving case e.g., Books vs books)
parameters.name: wordform

parameters.description: The written form of the word to look up with normalised case (Books --> books)
parameters.name: trueCase

parameters.description: The lemma of the word to look up (e.g., Book, booked, books all have the lemma "book")
parameters.name: lemma

parameters.description: The lexical category of the word(s) to look up (e.g., noun or verb)
parameters.name: lexicalCategory

400.description: You need to specify at least one option. Try one of 'wordform, lemma, trueCase, lexicalCategory'.

404.description: language is not in...

500.description: Internal Error. An error occurred while processing the data.

get.summary: Retrieve the frequency of a word derived from a corpus.

get.description:
This endpoint provides a list of frequencies for a given word or words. Unlike the /word/ endpoint, the results are split into the smallest units.

To exclude a specific value, prepend it with the minus sign ('-'). For example, to get frequencies of the lemma 'happy' but exclude superlative forms (i.e., happiest) you could use options 'lemma=happy;grammaticalFeatures=-degreeType:superlative'.

Parameters can be provided in PATH, GET or POST (form or json). The parameters in PATH are overridden by parameters in GET, POST and json (in that order). In PATH, individual options are separated by semicolon and values are separated by commas (where multiple values can be used).

The parameters wordform/trueCase/lemma/lexicalCategory also exist in a plural form, taking a lists of items. Examples: * PATH: /wordforms=happy,happier,happiest * GET: /?wordforms=happy&wordforms=happier&wordforms=happiest * POST (json): ```javascript { "wordforms": ["happy", "happier", "happiest"] } ``` A mor complex example of retrieving frequencies of multiple lemmas: ``` { "lemmas": ["happy", "content", "cheerful", "cheery", "merry", "joyful", "ecstatic"], "grammaticalFeatures": { "adjectiveFunctionType": "predicative" }, "lexicalCategory": "adjective", "sort": ["lemma", "-frequency"] } ``` Some queries with "collate" or "sort" can exceed the 30s timeout, in which case the API will return an error message with status code 503. You mitigate this by providing additional restrictions such as "minFrequency" and "maxFrequency".

You can use the parameters "offset" and "limit" to paginate through large result sets. For convenience, the HTTP header "Link" is set on the response to provide links to "first", "self", "next", "prev" and "last" pages of results (depending on the context). For example, if the result set contains 50 results and the parameter "limit" is set to 25, the Links header will contain an URL for the first 25 results and the next 25 results.

Some libraries such as python's `requests` can parse the header automatically and offer a convenient way of iterating through the results. For example: ```python def get_all_results(url): while url: r = requests.get(url) r.raise_for_status() for item in r.json()['results']: yield item url = r.links.get('next', {}).get('url') ```

parameters.description: IANA language code
parameters.name: source_lang

parameters.description: For corpora other than 'nmc' (New Monitor Corpus) please contact api@oxforddictionaries.com
parameters.name: corpus

parameters.description: The written form of the word to look up (preserving case e.g., Book vs book)
parameters.name: wordform

parameters.description: The written form of the word to look up with normalised case (Books --> books)
parameters.name: trueCase

parameters.description: The lemma of the word to look up (e.g., Book, booked, books all have the lemma "book")
parameters.name: lemma

parameters.description: The lexical category of the word(s) to look up (e.g., adjective or noun)
parameters.name: lexicalCategory

parameters.description: The grammatical features of the word(s) to look up entered as a list of k:v (e.g., degree_type:comparative)
parameters.name: grammaticalFeatures

parameters.description: sort the resulting list by wordform, trueCase, lemma, lexicalCategory, frequency, normalizedFrequency. Descending order is achieved by prepending the value with the minus sign ('-'). Multiple values can be separated by commas (e.g., sort=lexicalCategory,-frequency)
parameters.name: sort

parameters.description: collate the results by wordform, trueCase, lemma, lexicalCategory. Multiple values can be separated by commas (e.g., collate=trueCase,lemma,lexicalCategory).
parameters.name: collate

parameters.description: Restrict the query to entries with frequency of at least `minFrequency`
parameters.name: minFrequency

parameters.description: Restrict the query to entries with frequency of at most `maxFrequency`
parameters.name: maxFrequency

parameters.description: Restrict the query to entries with frequency of at least `minNormalizedFrequency`
parameters.name: minNormalizedFrequency

parameters.description: Restrict the query to entries with frequency of at most `maxNormalizedFrequency`
parameters.name: maxNormalizedFrequency

parameters.description: pagination - results offset
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: pagination - results limit
parameters.name: limit

get.summary: Retrieve a list of frequencies of a word/words derived from a corpus.

get.description: Use this to apply more complex filters to the [list of words](documentation/glossary?term=wordlist). For example, you may only want to filter out words for which all [senses](documentation/glossary?term=sense) match the filter, or only its 'prime sense'. You can also filter by word length or match by substring (prefix).

parameters.description: IANA language code
parameters.name: source_lang

parameters.description: Semicolon separated list of wordlist parameters, presented as value pairs: LexicalCategory, domains, regions, registers. Parameters can take comma separated list of values. E.g., lexicalCategory=noun,adjective;domains=sport. Number of values limited to 5.
parameters.name: filters_advanced

parameters.description: Semicolon separated list of parameters-value pairs (same as filters). Excludes headwords that have any senses in specified exclusion attributes (lexical categories, domains, etc.) from results.
parameters.name: exclude

parameters.description: Semicolon separated list of parameters-value pairs (same as filters). Excludes only those senses of a particular headword that match specified exclusion attributes (lexical categories, domains, etc.) from results but includes the headword if it has other permitted senses.
parameters.name: exclude_senses

parameters.description: Semicolon separated list of parameters-value pairs (same as filters). Excludes a headword only if the primary sense matches the specified exclusion attributes (registers, domains only).
parameters.name: exclude_prime_senses

parameters.description: Parameter to speficy the minimum (>), exact or maximum (<) length of the words required. E.g., >5 - more than 5 chars; <4 - less than 4 chars; >5<10 - from 5 to 10 chars; 3 - exactly 3 chars.
parameters.name: word_length

parameters.description: Filter words that start with prefix parameter
parameters.name: prefix

parameters.description: If exact=true wordlist returns a list of entries that exactly matches the search string. Otherwise wordlist lists entries that start with prefix string.
parameters.name: exact

parameters.description: Limit the number of results per response. Default and maximum limit is 5000.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Offset the start number of the result.
parameters.name: offset

400.description: disjoint sets of word_length values (eg <3>10); filter has no values; total number of filters > 20; filters and excludes values can not be the same; source_lang and translations can not be same; word_length conflicts with prefix length.

404.description: No entries is found matching supplied filters or lang or filters is not recognized.

500.description: Internal Error. An error occurred while processing the data.

get.summary: Retrieve list of words for category with advanced options

get.description: Use this to retrieve a [list of words](documentation/glossary?term=wordlist) for particular [domain](documentation/glossary?term=domain), [lexical category](documentation/glossary?term=lexicalcategory), [register](documentation/glossary?term=registers) and/or [region](documentation/glossary?term=regions). View the full list of possible filters using the filters Utility endpoint. The response only includes [headwords](documentation/glossary?term=headword), not all their possible [inflections](documentation/glossary?term=inflection). If you require a full [wordlist](documentation/glossary?term=wordlist) including [inflected forms](documentation/glossary?term=inflection), contact us and we can help.

parameters.description: IANA language code
parameters.name: source_lang

parameters.name: filters_basic

parameters.description: Limit the number of results per response. Default and maximum limit is 5000.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Offset the start number of the result
parameters.name: offset

400.description: filter has no values; total number of filters > 20.

404.description: No entries is found matching supplied filters or lang or filters is not recognized.

500.description: Internal Error. An error occurred while processing the data.

get.summary: Retrieve a list of words in a category

ArrayOfRelatedEntries.description: A list of written or spoken words

domains.description: A subject, discipline, or branch of knowledge particular to the Sense

language.description: IANA language code specifying the language of the word

regions.description: A particular area in which the pronunciation occurs, e.g. 'Great Britain'

registers.description: A level of language usage, typically with respect to formality. e.g. 'offensive', 'informal'

CategorizedTextList.description: various types of notes that appear

type.description: The descriptive category of the text

CrossReferencesList.description: A reference to another word that is closely related, might provide additional information about the subject, has a variant spelling or is an abbreviated form of it.

type.description: The type of relation between the two words. Possible values are 'close match', 'related', 'see also', 'variant spelling', and 'abbreviation' in case of crossreferences, or 'pre', 'post' in case of collocates.

etymologies.description: The origin of the word and the way in which its meaning has changed throughout history

homographNumber.description: Identifies the homograph grouping. The last two digits identify different entries of the same homograph. The first one/two digits identify the homograph number.

variantForms.description: Various words that are used interchangeably depending on the context, e.g 'a' and 'an'

ExamplesList.description: A list of written or spoken rendering of examples of use of a word or text

definitions.description: A list of statements of the exact meaning of a word

domains.description: A subject, discipline, or branch of knowledge particular to the Sense

regions.description: A particular area in which the pronunciation occurs, e.g. 'Great Britain'

registers.description: A level of language usage, typically with respect to formality. e.g. 'offensive', 'informal'

senseIds.description: The list of sense identifiers related to the example. Provided in the sentences endpoint only.

results.description: A mapping of filters available per endpoints.

entries.description: A list of filters available for Retrieve Entry endpoint

inflections.description: A list of filters available for LEMMATRON endpoint

translations.description: A list of filters available for Translations endpoint

wordlist.description: A list of filters available for Translations endpoint

GrammaticalFeaturesList.description: The different forms are correlated with meanings or functions which we text as 'features'

lexicalEntries.description: A grouping of various senses in a specific language, and a lexical category that relates to a word

type.description: The json object type. Could be 'headword', 'inflection' or 'phrase'

word.description: A given written or spoken realisation of a an entry, lowercased.

HeadwordLemmatron.description: Description of an inflected form of a word

lexicalEntries.description: A grouping of various senses in a specific language, and a lexical category that relates to a word

type.description: The json object type. Could be 'headword', 'inflection' or 'phrase'

word.description: A given written or spoken realisation of a an entry, lowercased.

HeadwordThesaurus.description: description of thesaurus information of a word

lexicalEntries.description: A grouping of various senses in a specific language, and a lexical category that relates to a word

type.description: The json object type. Could be 'headword', 'inflection' or 'phrase'

word.description: A given written or spoken realisation of a an entry, lowercased.

InflectionsList.description: A grouping of the modifications of a word to express different grammatical categories

results.description: A list of inflections matching a given word

LemmatronLexicalEntry.description: Description of an entry for a particular part of speech and grammatical features

inflectionOf.description: The canonical form of words for which the entry is an inflection

lexicalCategory.description: A linguistic category of words (or more precisely lexical items), generally defined by the syntactic or morphological behaviour of the lexical item in question, such as noun or verb

text.description: A given written or spoken realisation of a an entry.

results.description: A list of found ngrams along with their frequencies

frequency.description: The number of times the ngram (a sequence of n words) appears in the corpus

PronunciationsList.description: A list of possible pronunciations of a word

audioFile.description: The URL of the sound file

dialects.description: A local or regional variation where the pronunciation occurs, e.g. 'British English'

phoneticNotation.description: The alphabetic system used to display the phonetic spelling

phoneticSpelling.description: Phonetic spelling is the representation of vocal sounds which express pronunciations of words. It is a system of spelling in which each letter represents invariably the same spoken sound

regions.description: A particular area in which the pronunciation occurs, e.g. 'Great Britain'

additionalProperties.description: A list of lables for region.

results.description: A list of entries and all the data related to them

Sense.description: A lexical sense represents the lexical meaning of a lexical entry when interpreted as referring to the corresponding ontology element

definitions.description: A list of statements of the exact meaning of a word

domains.description: A subject, discipline, or branch of knowledge particular to the Sense

id.description: The id of the sense that is required for the delete procedure

regions.description: A particular area in which the Sense occurs, e.g. 'Great Britain'

registers.description: A level of language usage, typically with respect to formality. e.g. 'offensive', 'informal'

short_definitions.description: A list of short statements of the exact meaning of a word

subsenses.description: Ordered list of subsenses of a sense

thesaurusLinks.description: Ordered list of links to the Thesaurus Dictionary

variantForms.description: Various words that are used interchangeably depending on the context, e.g 'duck' and 'duck boat'

lexicalEntries.description: A grouping of various senses in a specific language, and a lexical category that relates to a word

type.description: The json object type. Could be 'headword', 'inflection' or 'phrase'

word.description: A given written or spoken realisation of a an entry, lowercased.

SentencesLexicalEntry.description: Description of an entry for a particular part of speech

lexicalCategory.description: A linguistic category of words (or more precisely lexical items), generally defined by the syntactic or morphological behaviour of the lexical item in question, such as noun or verb

sentences.description: A list of examples of use sentences

text.description: A given written or spoken realisation of a an entry.

results.description: A list of entries and all the data related to them

StatsWordResult.description: Schema for lexi-stats results for a word/trueCase/lemma/lexicalCategory returned as a frequency

result.description: Frequency information for a given entity

frequency.description: The number of times a word appears in the entire corpus

lemma.description: A lemma of the word (e.g., wordforms "lay", "laid" and "laying" have all lemma "lay")

lexicalCategory.description: A lexical category such as 'verb' or 'noun'

matchCount.description: The number of database records that matched the query params (stated frequency is the sum of the individual frequencies)

normalizedFrequency.description: The number of times a word appears on average in 1 million words

trueCase.description: A given written realisation of a an entry (e.g., "lay") usually lower case

wordform.description: A given written realisation of a an entry (e.g., "Lay") preserving case

StatsWordResultList.description: Schema for lexi-stats results for a word/trueCase/lemma/lexicalCategory returned as a list of frequencies per wordform-trueCase-lemma-lexicalCategory entry.

results.description: A list of found words along with their frequencies

frequency.description: The number of times a word appears in the entire corpus

lexicalCategory.description: A lexical category such as 'verb' or 'noun'

normalizedFrequency.description: The number of times a word appears on average in 1 million words

trueCase.description: A given written realisation of a an entry (e.g., "lay") usually lower case

wordform.description: A given written realisation of a an entry (e.g., "lay") preserving case

regions.description: A particular area in which the Sense occurs, e.g. 'Great Britain'

registers.description: A level of language usage, typically with respect to formality. e.g. 'offensive', 'informal'

results.description: A list of found synonyms or antonyms

homographNumber.description: Identifies the homograph grouping. The last two digits identify different entries of the same homograph. The first one/two digits identify the homograph number.

variantForms.description: Various words that are used interchangeably depending on the context, e.g 'a' and 'an'

ThesaurusLexicalEntry.description: Description of an entry for a particular part of speech

lexicalCategory.description: A linguistic category of words (or more precisely lexical items), generally defined by the syntactic or morphological behaviour of the lexical item in question, such as noun or verb

text.description: A given written or spoken realisation of a an entry.

variantForms.description: Various words that are used interchangeably depending on the context, e.g 'a' and 'an'

ThesaurusSense.description: A lexical sense represents the lexical meaning of a lexical entry when interpreted as referring to the corresponding ontology element

domains.description: A subject, discipline, or branch of knowledge particular to the Sense

id.description: The id of the sense that is required for the delete procedure

regions.description: A particular area in which the Sense occurs, e.g. 'Great Britain'

registers.description: A level of language usage, typically with respect to formality. e.g. 'offensive', 'informal'

TranslationsList.description: A list of written or spoken rendering of the meaning of a word or text in another language(s)

domains.description: A subject, discipline, or branch of knowledge particular to the translation

language.description: IANA language code specifying the language of the translation

regions.description: A particular area in which the translation occurs, e.g. 'Great Britain'

registers.description: A level of language usage, typically with respect to formality. e.g. 'offensive', 'informal'

UtilityLabels.description: Schema for lexicalcategories, registers utility endpoints.

additionalProperties.description: the list of labels for an object. Every object can be a lexical category, or a register, or a domain.

VariantFormsList.description: Various words that are used interchangeably depending on the context, e.g 'aluminium' and 'aluminum'

regions.description: A particular area in which the variant form occurs, e.g. 'Great Britain'

word.description: A given written or spoken realisation of a an entry, lowercased.

lexicalEntry.description: Description of an entry for a particular part of speech

derivativeOf.description: Other words from which this one derives

derivatives.description: Other words from which their Sense derives

lexicalCategory.description: A linguistic category of words (or more precisely lexical items), generally defined by the syntactic or morphological behaviour of the lexical item in question, such as noun or verb

text.description: A given written or spoken realisation of a an entry.

variantForms.description: Various words that are used interchangeably depending on the context, e.g 'a' and 'an'

thesaurusLink.description: Link to a sense of a specific entry in the thesaurus Dictionary
